title: How to Change Facebook Link on Mobile and Desktop

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This three-line icon will be at the top-right corner on Android, and the bottom-right on iPhone and iPad. To create a custom profile link (URL) on Facebook, you'll just need to change your Facebook Username .

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Settings & privacy . It's below Help & support . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . Your Facebook settings will expand.

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . It's at the top of the page under the "Meta" logo. If you don't see Accounts Center here, Facebook hasn't migrated your account to this new feature. In this case, scroll back up, tap Username , enter a new username, and tap Save Changes . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Profiles.
steps.content: Tap Profiles . This option is at the top of the Accounts Center.

steps.title: Select your Facebook account.
steps.content: Select your Facebook account. If you have multiple Facebook accounts or an Instagram account, you'll see more than one option. Tap the Facebook profile that you want to customize.

steps.title: Tap Username.
steps.content: Tap Username . This displays your current Facebook username, which is the part of the URL after facebook.com/ . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Type a new username and tap Done.
steps.content: Type a new username and tap Done . Once you change your username, your Facebook profile link will contain your new username. Your new username should be 5 characters or more, and can contain both letters and numbers. The only symbol allowed is a period (.). It must be unique; no two Facebook usernames can be the same.

steps.title: Click your profile photo at the top-right corner of Facebook.
steps.content: Click your profile photo at the top-right corner of Facebook. A menu will expand. If you're not already signed in to Facebook , you'll need to do so first.

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy . It's near the top of the menu.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's at the top of the menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Accounts Center.
steps.content: Click Accounts Center . You'll see this option in the left panel. If you don't see this option, your account hasn't been moved to Accounts Center yet. In this case, you should see "Username" in the right panel. Just click Edit to edit your username, and then click Save Changes to update your profile URL.

steps.title: Click Profiles.
steps.content: Click Profiles . This is at the top of the Accounts Center.

steps.title: Click your Facebook account.
steps.content: Click your Facebook account. If you have multiple Facebook accounts linked to the Accounts Center, click the account you want to edit. A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Click Username.
steps.content: Click Username . It's the second option. You'll see your current username here. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Type a new username and click Done.
steps.content: Type a new username and click Done . Your new username should be 5 characters or more, and can contain both letters and numbers. The only symbol allowed is a period (.). It must be unique; no two Facebook usernames can be the same. Once you click Done , your profile URL will be changed. If prompted, enter your Facebook password to confirm.

steps.title: Click your profile photo at the top-right corner of Facebook.
steps.content: Click your profile photo at the top-right corner of Facebook. A menu will expand. Use this method to change the URL of the Facebook Page you've created for your business or organization rather than your personal profile link. It's not currently possible to change your Facebook Page URL in the mobile app for Android, iPhone, or iPad. You'll need to access Facebook on a computer. [6] X Research source Make sure you are signed in with a Facebook account that has administrative access over the Facebook Page you want to edit.

steps.title: Click See all profiles.
steps.content: Click See all profiles . A list of Pages you manage will expand. If you don't see this option, your Page hasn't yet been migrated to the New Pages Experience. Instead, click Pages on the left side of your Facebook feed, choose your Page, and select Edit Page Info . Then, skip to Step 8 .

steps.title: Select the Facebook Page you want to customize.
steps.content: Select the Facebook Page you want to customize. This switches to your Facebook Page. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy, then Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy , then Settings . If you don't see this, click your profile icon.

steps.title: Click Page setup in the left pane.
steps.content: Click Page setup in the left pane. This is in the Audience and visibility section.

steps.title: Click Name.
steps.content: Click Name . Your General Page settings will expand.

steps.title: Click Edit next to "Username."
steps.content: Click Edit next to "Username." If you haven't changed your URL in the past, you'll see "You have not set a username" here.

steps.title: Type a new username and click Save Changes.
steps.content: Type a new username and click Save Changes . You'll do so in the text field to the right of the "Username" text. As long as the username is not taken and complies with Facebook's terms, you'll see "Username is available" and a green checkmark after typing your username. Once you click Save Changes , your Facebook Page link will be changed. [8] X Research source Your new username should be 5 characters or more, and can contain both letters and numbers. The only symbol allowed is a period (.). If prompted, enter your Facebook password to confirm.
